articleContent.title: Arpeggio: Minor 6th in F (Shape: E)
articleContent.content:
# Arpeggio: Minor 6th in F (Shape: E)

An arpeggio is the sounding of the individual notes of a chord in succession, rather than simultaneously. The Minor 6th arpeggio in the key of F with the shape of E consists of the notes F, Ab, C, and D. This arpeggio carries a melancholic, emotional quality due to the minor tonality of the chord.

## Notes and Intervals
- F (Root)
- Ab (Minor 3rd)
- C (Perfect 5th)
- D (Minor 6th)

## Genre and Musical Flavor
The Minor 6th arpeggio in F is commonly used in jazz, blues, and R&B music. It brings a soulful and introspective flavor to compositions when played with the appropriate phrasing and dynamics. This arpeggio can add depth and a sense of longing to a musical piece.

## Songs
Here are three songs that feature the Minor 6th arpeggio in F (Shape: E):
1. **"Blue in Green" by Miles Davis**: This jazz classic showcases the emotive power of the Minor 6th arpeggio in a beautiful, contemplative manner.
2. **"Stormy Monday" by T-Bone Walker**: A blues standard that incorporates the Minor 6th arpeggio to evoke a sense of sadness and melancholy.
3. **"Say You Won't Let Go" by James Arthur**: In this modern pop ballad, the Minor 6th arpeggio adds a touch of sophistication and drama to the chord progression.
